characters.name: Kay Faraday
characters.description1: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.

characters.name: Dick Gumshoe
characters.description1: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.

characters.name: Bronco Knight
characters.description1: A former bodyguard who killed his team leader. He is set to stand trial soon.
characters.description2: The victim. He was killed while being detained in the detention center's holding cells. His body was discovered in the prison proper.

characters.name: Eddie Fender
characters.description1: A defense attorney I have known for a long time, but haven't seen in years. Apparently, he lived abroad for a while.
characters.description2: Senior partner at Edgeworth and Co., and former assistant to my father. Also Simeon Saint's attorney.

characters.name: Rocco Carcerato
characters.description1: An inmate and former boxer who is obsessed with training. Has a pet polar bear named Teddy.
characters.description2: An inmate and former boxer who has dug a tunnel to the detention center from his cell and made his escape. Has a pet polar bear.
characters.description3: An inmate obsessed with escaping. A tunnel links his cell to Knight's holding cell.

characters.name: Verity Gavèlle
characters.description1: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.

characters.name: Eustace Winner
characters.description1: A rookie prosecutor who's taken over my cases on the Committee's orders.

characters.name: Simeon Saint
characters.description1: The suspect in this case. A timid young man who seems an unlikely murderer.
characters.description2: The suspect in this case. A trainee animal tamer at the Berry Big Circus.

characters.name: Fifi Laguarde
characters.description1: Warden of the prison. An animal lover who considers physical contact to be very important.

characters.name: Frank Sahwit
characters.description1: The prison inmate who first discovered the body. Currently training to be a pet stylist.
characters.description2: Prisoner and trainee pet stylist who first discovered the body. His security bracelet is broken.

characters.name: Bodhidharma Kanis
characters.description1: A blind ex-assassin whose favored tools were a black dog and a knife. The tinkling of small bells used to accompany his appearance.

characters.name: Shi-Long Lang
characters.description1: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.

characters.name: Regina Berry
characters.description1: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.

evidences.name: Prosecutor's Badge
evidences.description1: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.

evidences.name: Building Layout
evidences.description1: A map of the facility, including the detention center and the prison proper.

evidences.name: Mr. Knight's Body
evidences.description1: Cause of death: Stab wound to the throat. Death would have been instant. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. [info] The victim had a ring on his right hand, which was covered by a sheet when the body was discovered.
evidences.description2: Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. The body is covered in dirt. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head.
evidences.description3: Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. A sweet scent can be detected.

evidences.name: Pocket Chess Set
evidences.description1: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It appears to have belonged to the victim.
evidences.description2: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It belonged to Knight, and was brought to him at his request by Saint.
evidences.description3: Portable folding chessboard. Belonged to Knight. There is a hidden space inside the chessboard.
evidences.description4: Knight hid a chisel in here to prevent it from being found by the prison staff.

evidences.name: Rubber Glove
evidences.description1: Only one glove was found at the crime scene. Prison-issued equipment for working inmates. Stained with blood and mud.
evidences.description2: Found in Workshop A. Used by Sahwit when he was doing his animal styling training. Stained with blood and mud.
evidences.description3: Found in Workshop A. Sullied after being worn by Sahwit when administering a dark mudpack treatment. Also bloodstained.

evidences.name: Rope
evidences.description1: Discovered on top of Knight's body. Does this mean the victim was tied up?

evidences.name: Bloodstained Sheet
evidences.description1: Colorful tarp found by the victim's body. Some of these were being stored in Workshop A.

evidences.name: Door Sensor
evidences.description1: Fitted to each workshop's door, they detect and react to the prisoners' bracelets when they are near by raising the alarm.
evidences.description2: They open the doors if an animal is detected, but raise the alarm if an inmate's bracelet is detected. Prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.

evidences.name: Prison Roll Call
evidences.description1: Held three times a day: 7 AM, noon, and 9 PM. The victim's body had not been found at the time of the 7 AM roll call.

evidences.name: Black Dog
evidences.description1: Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat. He doesn't seem to like me very much.

evidences.name: Sahwit's Bracelet
evidences.description1: Sahwit's bracelet is broken, and can no longer be detected by the prison's sensors.
evidences.description2: Sahwit's bracelet wasn't working at the time of the incident, and could not be detected by the sensors.

evidences.name: Dog Chess Piece
evidences.description1: Carved for fun by Kanis. He also seems to be engaged in correspondence chess via postal mail.

evidences.name: Prison Search
evidences.description1: Winner, Gavèlle and the warden searched the prison for the murder weapon, but couldn't find anything.

evidences.name: Wiped Floor
evidences.description1: There are signs that the floor in the victim's detention center cell was wiped clean.
evidences.description2: There are signs that the floor in the victim's cell was wiped clean. I've ordered a test to see if it was blood.
evidences.description3: There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. We're currently checking whose blood it is.
evidences.description4: There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. The blood has been confirmed as Knight's.

evidences.name: Chess Diagram
evidences.description1: The positions of the pieces match those on the board in Kanis's cell.
evidences.description2: Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. Did the two have some sort of connection?

evidences.name: Security Camera Footage
evidences.description1: Footage of a detention center holding cell showing the victim being attacked by a dark form.
evidences.description2: The time stamp is off due to a three-hour gap in the footage. This was actually recorded around 9 AM.

evidences.name: Missing Guard Uniform
evidences.description1: Stolen from a guard's locker in the detention center corridor on March 26th.

evidences.name: Mr. Knight's Cell Key
evidences.description1: A guard was attacked and his keys, including the one to Knight's cell, were stolen. They have yet to be recovered.
evidences.description2: A guard was attacked the day before the murder, and his keys were stolen. They were found in Carcerato's possession.

evidences.name: Security Gates
evidences.description1: Deployed at the entrances to both the detention center and the prison proper. Capable of detecting items made of metal.

evidences.name: Tunnel Prints
evidences.description1: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. It seems to depict the paw prints of a dog.
evidences.description2: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. Shows paw prints made by a bear.

evidences.name: Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: The interim report suggests that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade. Death was instantaneous.
evidences.description2: Estimated time of death is between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. Instant death from a stab wound to the neck.

evidences.name: Chisel
evidences.description1: Contains traces of blood. Hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Has a small bell attached to it.
evidences.description2: Belonged to Knight. Hidden by Kanis in Helmut's mouth in order to avoid suspicion.

evidences.name: Mr. Kanis's Bells
evidences.description1: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.

evidences.name: Mr. Saint's Trick
evidences.description1: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show.
evidences.description2: Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights were replaced with the victim's body by someone.

evidences.name: Breakers
evidences.description1: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?
